paragraphs.text: “My bill doesn’t eliminate [the EPA] right away, but sunsets the agency by 2018,” Gaetz told the crowd. “I want to keep the Clean Air Act and the Clean Water Act… take the power out of Washington and back into the states.”
paragraphs.name: 74c3

667c807b9aa4.title: I am- unfortunately- in Matt Gaetz’s district.

paragraphs.name: e004
paragraphs.text: I am- unfortunately- in Matt Gaetz’s district. I attended the protest at his town hall meeting. You have to remember, this is THE most conservative part of Florida. We had between 300 and 400 people come out to 3 different events. We chanted and held up signs and let him kn0w that we need the EPA. He is not what you would call a smart person, but I think we made an impression on him.

paragraphs.text: What an idiot. Nature doesn’t give two craps about the political of the states. The EPA exists because neighboring states couldn’t get along and like any neighbors in America, blew leaves into each others’ yards, both claiming they fell from the trees overhead.

paragraphs.name: 539a
paragraphs.text: Wardell, you can look at Florida as the cause of Lake Okeechobee. The Governor refuses to allow the purchase of more land to drain water south. The area above the lake has been overdeveloped due to lax or non-existent regulations. They continue dumping pollution into the lake. THIS is the problem with doing away with the EPA. Are they perfect? NO…

31dfd4aa9d60.title: The reason that the GOP wants to give EPA funds to the states is it will weaken the capacity to sue…

paragraphs.name: ca85
paragraphs.text: The reason that the GOP wants to give EPA funds to the states is it will weaken the capacity to sue the large corporations who pollute. They can spend much more money than most states can in state courts. Most states do not have laws on the books that cover many of the regulations. And in the red states these regulations will never be implemented.
